specJson.name: brightics.function.clustering$gaussian_mixture_train2
specJson.description:
A Gaussian mixture model is a probabilistic model that assumes all the data points are generated from a mixture of a finite number of Gaussian distributions with unknown parameters. One can think of mixture models as generalizing k-means clustering to incorporate information about the covariance structure of the data as well as the centers of the latent Gaussians.

- Pros : It is the fastest algorithm for learning mixture models. As this algorithm maximizes only the likelihood, it will not bias the means towards zero, or bias the cluster sizes to have specific structures that might or might not apply.

- Cons : When one has insufficiently many points per mixture, estimating the covariance matrices becomes difficult, and the algorithm is known to diverge and find solutions with infinite likelihood unless one regularizes the covariances artificially. This algorithm will always use all the components it has access to, needing held-out data or information theoretical criteria to decide how many components to use in the absence of external cues.

Reference:
+ <https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mixture_model#Gaussian_mixture_model>
+ <https://scikit-learn.org/stable/modules/generated/sklearn.mixture.GaussianMixture.html>

table.desc: Training data in a Table. It must contain at least one column for labels.

out_table.desc: Data table with the prediction column.

params.label: Input Columns
params.description: Input column names. Only values in numeric type are possible.

params.label: Covariance Type
params.description:
String describing the type of covariance parameters to use. Must be one of:

 Full : each component has its own general covariance matrix
 Tied : all components share the same general covariance matrix
 Diagonal : each component has its own diagonal covariance matrix
 Spherical : each component has its own single variance

params.label: Tolerance
params.description: The convergence threshold. EM iterations will stop when the lower bound average gain is below this threshold.

params.label: Regularization of Covariance
params.description: Non-negative regularization added to the diagonal of covariance. Allows to assure that the covariance matrices are all positive.

params.label: Number of Iteration
params.description: The number of EM iterations to perform.

params.label: Method to Initialize
params.description:
The method used to initialize the weights, the means and the precisions. Must be one of:

K-means : responsibilities are initialized using kmeans.
Random : responsibilities are initialized randomly.

params.label: Seed
params.description: Random seed. Use the same seed in order to reproduce the same results.

summary.en: This function trains an gaussian mixture clustering model.

md.en: # Gaussian Mixture This function trains an gaussian mixture clustering model. ## Description A Gaussian mixture model is a probabilistic model that assumes all the data points are generated from a mixture of a finite number of Gaussian distributions with unknown parameters. One can think of mixture models as generalizing k-means clustering to incorporate information about the covariance structure of the data as well as the centers of the latent Gaussians. - Pros : It is the fastest algorithm for learning mixture models. As this algorithm maximizes only the likelihood, it will not bias the means towards zero, or bias the cluster sizes to have specific structures that might or might not apply. - Cons : When one has insufficiently many points per mixture, estimating the covariance matrices becomes difficult, and the algorithm is known to diverge and find solutions with infinite likelihood unless one regularizes the covariances artificially. This algorithm will always use all the components it has access to, needing held-out data or information theoretical criteria to decide how many components to use in the absence of external cues. Reference: + + ## Properties ### VA #### INPUT 1. **table***: (Table) Training data in a Table. It must contain at least one column for labels. #### OUTPUT 1. **out_table**: (Table) Data table with the prediction column. 2. **model**: (Model) Trained Gaussian Mixture model. #### PARAMETER 1. **Input Columns***: Input column names. Only values in numeric type are possible. 2. **Number of Components**: The number of mixture components. 3. **Prediction Column Name**: Column name for prediction 4. **Covariance Type**: String describing the type of covariance parameters to use. Must be one of: * `Full` : each component has its own general covariance matrix * `Tied` : all components share the same general covariance matrix * `Diagonal` : each component has its own diagonal covariance matrix * `Spherical` : each component has its own single variance 5. **Tolerance**: The convergence threshold. EM iterations will stop when the lower bound average gain is below this threshold. 6. **Regularization of Covariance**: Non-negative regularization added to the diagonal of covariance. Allows to assure that the covariance matrices are all positive. 7. **Number of Iteration**: The number of EM iterations to perform. 8. **Method to Initialize**: The method used to initialize the weights, the means and the precisions. Must be one of: * `K-means` : responsibilities are initialized using kmeans. * `Random` : responsibilities are initialized randomly. 9. **Seed**: Random seed. Use the same seed in order to reproduce the same results. 10. **Group By**: Columns to group by. ### Python #### USAGE ``` gaussian_mixture_train2(table = , input_cols = , number_of_components = , prediction_col = , covariance_type = , tolerance = , regularize_covariance = , max_iteration = , initial_params = , seed = , group_by = ) ``` #### INPUT 1. **table***: (Table) Training data in a Table. It must contain at least one column for labels. #### OUTPUT 1. **out_table**: (Table) Data table with the prediction column. 2. **model**: (Model) Trained Gaussian Mixture model. #### PARAMETER 1. **input_cols***: Input column names. Only values in numeric type are possible. * Type: *list[str]* 2. **number_of_components**: The number of mixture components. * Type: *int* * Default / Range: 1 (value >= 1) 3. **prediction_col**: Column name for prediction * Type: *str* * Default value: prediction 4. **covariance_type**: String describing the type of covariance parameters to use. Must be one of: * `full` : each component has its own general covariance matrix * `tied` : all components share the same general covariance matrix * `diagonal` : each component has its own diagonal covariance matrix * `spherical` : each component has its own single variance * Type: *str* * Default / Range: full ( full | tied | diag | spherical ) 5. **tolerance**: The convergence threshold. EM iterations will stop when the lower bound average gain is below this threshold. * Type: *double* * Default / Range: 0.001 (value > 0) 6. **regularize_covariance**: Non-negative regularization added to the diagonal of covariance. Allows to assure that the covariance matrices are all positive. * Type: *double* * Default / Range: 0.000001 (value > 0) 7. **max_iteration**: The number of EM iterations to perform. * Type: *int* * Default / Range: 100 (value >= 1) 8. **initial_params**: The method used to initialize the weights, the means and the precisions. Must be one of: * `kmeans` : responsibilities are initialized using kmeans. * `random` : responsibilities are initialized randomly. * Type: *str* * Default / Range: kmeans ( kmeans | random ) 9. **seed**: Random seed. Use the same seed in order to reproduce the same results. * Type: *int* * Default value: None 10. **group_by**: Columns to group by. * Type: *list[str]* * Default value: None ## Example ### VA **[Sample Model]** In this tutorial workflow, sample_iris data is used to train a gaussian mixture. The generated model is afterward applied to a test data set to predict the cluster of data, by using Gaussian Mixture Predict function. The parameter settings used in the function are shown below. ++Parameters++ 1. **Input Columns***: sepal_length, sepal_width 2. **Number of Components**: 3 3. **Prediction Column Name**: prediction 4. **Covariance Type**: Full 5. **Tolerance**: 0.001 6. **Regularization of Covariance**: 0.000001 7. **Number of Iteration**: 100 8. **Method to Initialize**: Random 9. **Seed**: None 10. **Group By**: None ### Python ``` from brightics.function.clustering import gaussian_mixture_train2 input_table = inputs[0] result = gaussian_mixture_train2(table=input_table, input_cols=['sepal_width', 'sepal_length'], number_of_components=3, prediction_col='prediction', covariance_type='full', tolerance=0.001, regularize_covariance=0.000001, max_iteration=100, initial_params='kmeans', seed=None, group_by=None) output_table = result['out_table'] output_model = result['model'] ``` In this tutorial workflow, sample_iris data is used to train a gaussian mixture. The generated model is afterward applied to a test data set to predict the cluster of data, by using Gaussian Mixture Predict function.
md.kr: # 가우시안 혼합 이 함수는 가우시언 혼합 클러스터링 모델을 학습한다. ## Description 가우시언 혼합 모델은 데이터 포인트가 알려지지 않은 모수를 가지는 유한한 개수의 가우시언 분포에서 생성되었다고 가정하는 확률모델이다. 이 모델은 데이터의 공분산과 잠재 가우시언 분포의 평균까지 고려해서 일반화된 k-means 클러스터링을 생성하는 것으로 이해할 수 있다. - Pros : 가우시언 혼합 모델은 혼합 모델을 훈련하는 가장 빠른 알고리듬이다. 이 모델은 우도를 최대화하기 때문에 평균을 0으로 편향하거나 클러스터 의 크기를 특정한 구조를 가지도록 만들지 않는다. - Cons : 가우시언 혼합 모델은 혼합마다 데이터 포인트 수가 충분하지 않으면 공분산 행렬의 계산이 어렵다. 그리고 공분산을 인위적으로 regularize하지 않으면 알고리듬은 무한한 우도를 가지는 해를 찾으며 발산하는 것으로 알려져 있다. 알고리듬은 항상 이용 가능한 모든 컴포넌트를 사용하려고 하므로 외부 단서가 없을 때 홀드아웃이나 얼마나 많은 컴포넌트를 이용할지에 대한 정보이론에 기반한 기준이 필요하다. Reference: + + ## Properties ### VA #### INPUT 1. **table***: (Table) 트레이닝 데이터. 레이블 컬럼을 포함해야 한다. #### OUTPUT 1. **out_table**: (Table) 예측 컬럼을 포함하는 결과 테이블. 2. **model**: (Model) 훈련된 가우시언 혼합 모델. #### PARAMETER 1. **Input Columns***: 인풋으로 선택할 컬럼. 숫자형 데이터만 가능. 2. **Number of Components**: 혼합 컴포넌트 수. 3. **Prediction Column Name**: 예측 컬럼 이름. 4. **Covariance Type**: 사용할 공분산 모수 이름. 다음 중에서 선택: * `Full` : 각 컴포넌트가 자신의 공분산 행렬을 가짐. * `Tied` : 모든 컴포넌트가 공분산 행렬을 공유함. * `Diagonal` : 각 컴포넌트가 자신의 대각 공분산 행렬을 가짐. * `Spherical` : 각 컴포넌트가 각각 하나의 분산을 가짐. 5. **Tolerance**: 수렴 임계 값. lower bound average gain이 이 값보다 작으면 EM 반복을 중단함. 6. **Regularization of Covariance**: 공분산 행렬에 더할 음이 아닌 regularization. 공분산 행렬을 positive로 만듦. 7. **Number of Iteration**: EM 반복 횟수. 8. **Method to Initialize**: 가중치, 평균, 정확도 초기화 방법. 다음 중에서 선택: * `K-means` : k-means 이용해서 초기화. * `Random` : random하게 초기화. 9. **Seed**: 랜덤 시드. 같은 결과를 얻으려면 같은 시드를 사용해야 함. 10. **Group By**: 그룹화 컬럼. ### Python #### USAGE ``` gaussian_mixture_train2(table = , input_cols = , number_of_components = , prediction_col = , covariance_type = , tolerance = , regularize_covariance = , max_iteration = , initial_params = , seed = , group_by = ) ``` #### INPUT 1. **table***: (Table) 트레이닝 데이터. 레이블 컬럼을 포함해야 한다. #### OUTPUT 1. **out_table**: (Table) 예측 컬럼을 포함하는 결과 테이블. 2. **model**: (Model) 훈련된 가우시언 혼합 모델. #### PARAMETER 1. **input_cols***: 인풋으로 선택할 컬럼. 숫자형 데이터만 가능. * Type: *list[str]* 2. **number_of_components**: 혼합 컴포넌트 수. * Type: *int* * Default / Range: 1 (value >= 1) 3. **prediction_col**: 예측 컬럼 이름. * Type: *str* * Default value: prediction 4. **covariance_type**: 사용할 공분산 모수 이름. 다음 중에서 선택: * `Full` : 각 컴포넌트가 자신의 공분산 행렬을 가짐. * `Tied` : 모든 컴포넌트가 공분산 행렬을 공유함. * `Diagonal` : 각 컴포넌트가 자신의 대각 공분산 행렬을 가짐. * `Spherical` : 각 컴포넌트가 각각 하나의 분산을 가짐. * Type: *str* * Default / Range: full ( full | tied | diag | spherical ) 5. **tolerance**: 수렴 임계 값. lower bound average gain이 이 값보다 작으면 EM 반복을 중단함. * Type: *double* * Default / Range: 0.001 (value > 0) 6. **regularize_covariance**: 공분산 행렬에 더할 음이 아닌 regularization. 공분산 행렬을 positive로 만듦. * Type: *double* * Default / Range: 0.000001 (value > 0) 7. **max_iteration**: EM 반복 횟수. * Type: *int* * Default / Range: 100 (value >= 1) 8. **initial_params**: 가중치, 평균, 정확도 초기화 방법. 다음 중에서 선택: * `K-means` : k-means 이용해서 초기화. * `Random` : random하게 초기화. * Type: *str* * Default / Range: kmeans ( kmeans | random ) 9. **seed**: 랜덤 시드. 같은 결과를 얻으려면 같은 시드를 사용해야 함. * Type: *int* * Default value: None 10. **group_by**: 그룹화 컬럼. * Type: *list[str]* * Default value: None ## Example ### VA **[Sample Model]** 이 예제에서는 sample_iris 데이터를 이용해서 가우시언 혼합 모델을 훈련한다. 훈련된 모델은 Gaussian Mixture Predict 함수를 이용해서 데이터 클러스터를 예측하는데 사용될 수 있다. 예제에 사용된 파라미터 설정은 아래와 같다. ++Parameters++ 1. **Input Columns***: sepal_length, sepal_width 2. **Number of Components**: 3 3. **Prediction Column Name**: prediction 4. **Covariance Type**: Full 5. **Tolerance**: 0.001 6. **Regularization of Covariance**: 0.000001 7. **Number of Iteration**: 100 8. **Method to Initialize**: Random 9. **Seed**: None 10. **Group By**: None ### Python ``` from brightics.function.clustering import gaussian_mixture_train2 input_table = inputs[0] result = gaussian_mixture_train2(table=input_table, input_cols=['sepal_width', 'sepal_length'], number_of_components=3, prediction_col='prediction', covariance_type='full', tolerance=0.001, regularize_covariance=0.000001, max_iteration=100, initial_params='kmeans', seed=None, group_by=None) output_table = result['out_table'] output_model = result['model'] ``` 이 예제에서는 sample_iris 데이터를 이용해서 가우시언 혼합 모델을 훈련한다. 훈련된 모델은 Gaussian Mixture Predict 함수를 이용해서 데이터 클러스터를 예측하는데 사용될 수 있다.

sampleImages.label: gaussian_mixture.png
sampleImages.description: In this tutorial workflow, sample_iris data is used to train a gaussian mixture. The generated model is afterward applied to a test data set to predict the cluster of data, by using Gaussian Mixture Predict function. The parameter settings used in the function are shown below.
sampleImages.parameter: 1. **Input Columns***: sepal_length, sepal_width 2. **Number of Components**: 3 3. **Prediction Column Name**: prediction 4. **Covariance Type**: Full 5. **Tolerance**: 0.001 6. **Regularization of Covariance**: 0.000001 7. **Number of Iteration**: 100 8. **Method to Initialize**: Random 9. **Seed**: None 10. **Group By**: None

scriptExamples.code:
from brightics.function.clustering import gaussian_mixture_train2
input_table = inputs[0]
result = gaussian_mixture_train2(table=input_table,
								 input_cols=['sepal_width', 'sepal_length'],
                                 number_of_components=3,
								 prediction_col='prediction',
                                 covariance_type='full',
								 tolerance=0.001,
								 regularize_covariance=0.000001,
								 max_iteration=100,
								 initial_params='kmeans',
								 seed=None,
								 group_by=None)
output_table = result['out_table']
output_model = result['model']
scriptExamples.description: In this tutorial workflow, sample_iris data is used to train a gaussian mixture. The generated model is afterward applied to a test data set to predict the cluster of data, by using Gaussian Mixture Predict function.
